_prev_prog_3.MS_OtherType: Firewater system with fixed and variable monitors
_prev_prog_3.CH_OtherChanges: Unit relief block valves car sealed open
_prev_prog_3.Description: The Propane/Propylene Splitter Process at the Mont Belvieu Complex has a complete 14-issue safety management program designed to be compliant with the requirements of the OSHA Process Safety Management Standard and the EPA Risk Management Program Rule.  The prevention program shares some policies and procedures (e.g. Contractor qualifications, Hot Work permitting, Compliance Audits) with the other processes in the Mont Belvieu Complex, but retains process specific program information on some issues such as Process Hazard Analysis, Operating Procedures, and portions of other issues where necessary.  Some issues in the program contain information specific to the Propane/Propylene Splitter Process, but share procedures, files or databases with other issues (e.g. Process Safety Information; Mechanical Integrity; some technician Training; etc).  Additional details on the complete Mont Belvieu Complex accident prevention / safety management program can be found in the Executive Summary.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


ENTERPRISE PRODUCTS OPERATING - MONT BELVIEU FACILITY
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

At the Enterprise Products Mont Belvieu Facility, we are committed to operating and maintaining all of our processes (especially those using hazardous substances) in a safe and responsible manner.  We use a combination of accidental release prevention programs and emergency response planning programs to help ensure the safety of our employees and the public, as well as protection of the environment.  This document provides a brief overview of the comprehensive risk management activities that we have designed and implemented, including:

* A description of our facility and use of substances required by EPA's RMP regulation
* An overview of our accidental release prevention programs
* A five-year accident history for accidental releases of chemicals at the Mont Belvieu Complex that are regulated by EPA's RMP rule.    

The processes involved include fractionation, reaction, separation, and distillation.  Enterprise utilizes gas-fired turbines to generate electricity or run compressors, and to supply heat for process operations.  Additionally, there are a number of gas-fried heaters to provide heat for various processes including distillation.  The facility utilizes three flares: south flare (for the south complex), LRGO flare (for the Splitter I, West Terminal and Dow), and north flare (for MTBE and Splitter II).

In our processes, we use the following chemicals that EPA has identified as having the potential to cause significant offsite consequences in the event of a substantial accidental release:

Toxics

Chlorine is used in the regeneration process of the oleflex catalyst and is consumed in that portion of the Iso-Octane/MTBE unit.  A small amount of Chlorine is kept at the Mont Belvieu Complex for this purpose.

Ammonia is used as a reagent treating the Iso-Octane/MTBE unit turbine exhaust in the SCR packing.  Ammonia is stored

in a coded pressure vessel and is contained in a closed loop system until it is consumed in the SCR process in the heat recovery unit.

Flammables

Propane is a finished product at the Mont Belvieu facility.  A portion of this production comes from the Propylene Splitter units, as well as the NGL Fractionators.  The quantity of this product is distributed throughout the complex.

Propylene is a finished product.  All of this production line is derived from the two propylene Splitter units.  The quantity is distributed between the unit production and the Storage Well.

Isobutane is produced in the Butamer units of which there are three running in parallel.  This is done by converting normal butane into isobutene.

Normal Butane is the feed to the Butamer units.  Most normal butane is pipelined directly into the Butamer unit and is converted to isobutene.

Mixed butanes are produced from the NGL Fractionators and Butamer units and are fed to De-Isobutanizers, which separate the isobutene and normal butane.  Normal Pentane and Iso-Pentane are present in the natural gasoline bottoms from the NGL Fractionators.

Isobutene is produced and then consumed in the Isomerization Process.  Isobutene is not present either in one of the feedstocks or in a finished product.  

Our accidental release prevention program and our contingency planning efforts help us effectively manage the hazards that are posed to our employees, the public, and the environment by our use of these chemicals.


KEY OFFSITE CONSEQUENCE ANALYSIS SCENARIOS

EPA's RMP rule requires that we provide information about the worst-case scenarios(s) and alternative release scenario(s) for our facility.  This data is in the RMP data field of the report.

This information is used  to help us ensure that our emergency response plan and the community emergency response plan address all reasonable contingency cases.

GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

Enterprise Product

s takes a systematic, protective approach to preventing accidental release of hazardous chemicals.  The Process Safety Management systems address each of the key features of successful prevention program, including:

* Process safety information
* Process hazard analysis
* Operating procedures
* Training
* Mechanical integrity
* Management of change
* Pre-Startup Safety Review - "PSSR"
* Compliance audits
* Incident investigation
* Employee participation
* Hot work permit
* Contractors

As a part of the prevention efforts, there are a multitude of programs in which Enterprise employees participate.  A training program has been developed in which the Operations and Maintenance personnel are specifically trained in the operation of the plant, the operating procedures, maintenance procedures, and specific other regulations and policies, as well as in all areas of emergency response.  Employees are trained on, use, and apply the guidelines of our PSM program, which include all of the above-listed areas.  All of these programs come under scheduled scrutiny and critique.

There is an on-going inspection program designed to search out and find deficiencies with the process equipment prior to any incident.

The Operations personnel make regular inspections of the equipment and processes they operate.  If something out of the ordinary is found, it is reported to management in order to expediently resolve any problems.

ACCIDENT HISTORY

Records are kept for all significant accidental chemical releases that occur at our facility.  The following is a brief summary of accidental chemical releases involving materials covered under EPA's RMP rule during the past five years:

During the last five years, there have been no incidents at the Mont Belvieu facility involving hazardous chemicals covered by the RMP rule that resulted in inury, death, significant on-site property damage,or off-site consequences. 

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Enterprise maintains an integrated contingency

plan, which consolidates all of the various federal, state, and local regulatory requirements for emergency response planning.  The program provides the essential planning and training for effectively protecting the workers, the public, and the environment during emergency situations.  Furthermore, the plan is coordinated with the Mutual Aid Mont Belvieu group, which includes the Mont Belvieu Police, fire department, and Emergency Medical Service as well as the Chambers County Emergency Management system.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

The following is a list of improvements that are planned for implementation at the facility to help prevent and/or better respond to accidental chemical releases:

* The Mont Belvieu complex has budgeted funds for a new and upgraded emergency notification system for internal plant alarms to be installed next year.
* Additional video monitoring cameras to ensure adequate visual monitoring of the process area are being installed in conjunction with the new Fractionator IV project.
*  The complex continues to make improvements and updates to the hazardous gas and fire detection systems installed in the process areas of the plant.
* Enterprise is currently reviewing and revising the entire safety management / accident prevention program to ensure that the program safety requirements can be uniformly met by all Enterprise owned and/or operated facilities.
